features.name: Arcane Pool
features.desc:
At 1st level, the magus gains a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that he can draw upon to fuel his powers and enhance his weapon. This arcane pool has a number of points equal to 1/2 his magus level (minimum 1) + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. The pool refreshes once per day when the magus prepares his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Spell Combat
features.desc: At 1st level, a magus learns to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and wield his weapons at the same time. This functions much like two-weapon fighting, but the off-hand weapon is a spell that is being cast. To use this ability, the magus must have one hand free, while wielding a light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} melee weapon in the other hand. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, he can make all of his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with his melee weapon at a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and can also cast any spell from the magus spell list with a {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} (any attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} made as part of this spell also takes this penalty).

features.name: Magus Proficiencies
features.desc: A magus is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. A magus is also proficient with light armor. He can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing medium armor, heavy armor, or a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure. A multiclass magus still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.

features.name: Cantrips
features.desc: Magi can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Spellstrike
features.desc:
At 2nd level, whenever a magus casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a range of "{g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}" from the magus spell list, he can deliver the spell through any weapon he is wielding as part of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}.
Instead of the free melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} normally allowed to deliver the spell, a magus can make one free melee attack with his weapon (at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. If successful, this melee attack deals its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as well as the effects of the spell. If the magus makes this attack in concert with spell combat, this melee attack takes all the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} accrued by spell combat melee attacks.
This attack uses the weapon's {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} range (20, 19–20, or 18–20 and modified by the keen weapon property or similar effects), but the spell effect only deals ×2 damage on a successful critical hit, while the weapon damage uses its own critical modifier.

features.name: Magus Arcana
features.desc: As he gains levels, a magus learns arcane secrets tailored to his specific way of blending martial puissance and magical {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. Starting at 3rd level, a magus gains one magus arcana. He gains an additional magus arcana for every three levels of magus attained after 3rd level. Unless specifically noted in a magus arcana's description, a magus cannot select a particular magus arcana more than once.

features.name: Spell Recall
features.desc: At 4th level, the magus learns to use his arcane pool to recall {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} he has already cast. With a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} he can recall any single magus spell that he has already prepared and cast that day by expending a number of points from his arcane pool equal to the spell's level (minimum 1). The spell is prepared again, just as if it had not been cast.

features.name: Magus Bonus Feat
features.desc: <null-string>

features.name: Arcane Weapon (+2)
features.desc:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Arcane Medium Armor
features.desc: At 7th level, a magus gains proficiency with medium armor. A magus can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing medium armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing heavy armor or using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure.

features.name: Improved Spell Combat
features.desc: At 8th level, the magus's ability to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} improves. When using the spell combat ability, the magus receives a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}.

features.name: Arcane Weapon (+3)
features.desc:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Fighter Training
features.desc: Starting at 10th level, a magus counts 1/2 his total magus level as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.

features.name: Improved Spell Recall
features.desc: At 11th level, the magus's ability to recall {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} using his arcane pool becomes more efficient. Whenever he recalls a spell with spell recall, he expends a number of points from his arcane pool equal to 1/2 the spell's level (minimum 1).

features.name: Arcane Weapon (+4)
features.desc:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Arcane Heavy Armor
features.desc: At 13th level, a magus gains proficiency with heavy armor. A magus can cast magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure.

features.name: Greater Spell Combat
features.desc: At 14th level, the magus gains the ability to seamlessly cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. Whenever he uses the spell combat ability, his {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from Improved Spell Combat increases to +4.

features.name: Counterstrike
features.desc: At 16th level, whenever an enemy within {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of the magus successfully casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} defensively, that enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the magus after the spell is complete.

features.name: Arcane Weapon (+5)
features.desc:
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Greater Spell Access
features.desc: At 19th level, the magus gains access to an expanded {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list. He learns 6 spells of any levels from 1st to 6th from the wizard's spell list and places them into his spellbook as magus spells of their wizard level.

features.name: True Magus
features.desc:
At 20th level, the magus becomes a master of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and combat. Whenever he uses his spell combat ability, he does not need to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} to cast the spell defensively.
Whenever the magus uses spell combat, he can choose to either increase the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist his spells{/g} by 2, grant himself a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on any {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome spell resistance, or grant himself a +2 circumstance bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}.

features.name: Bloodline
features.desc:
Each eldrich scion has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, an eldrich scion might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the eldrich scion gains levels. An eldrich scion must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of eldrich scion. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some eldrich scions, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, an eldrich scion learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, an eldrich scion receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The eldrich scion must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.

features.name: Eldritch Pool
features.desc:
At 1st level, the magus gains a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that he can draw upon to fuel his powers and enhance his weapon. This arcane pool has a number of points equal to 1/2 his magus level (minimum 1) + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. The pool refreshes once per day when the magus prepares his {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
At 1st level, a magus can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant any weapon he is holding a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: flaming, flaming burst, frost, icy burst, keen, shock, shocking burst, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These properties are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. These bonuses and properties are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the magus uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the magus.
A magus can only enhance one weapon in this way at one time. If he uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.

features.name: Cantrips
features.desc: Magi can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Magus Arcana
features.desc: As he gains levels, a magus learns arcane secrets tailored to his specific way of blending martial puissance and magical {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. Starting at 3rd level, a magus gains one magus arcana. He gains an additional magus arcana for every three levels of magus attained after 3rd level. Unless specifically noted in a magus arcana's description, a magus cannot select a particular magus arcana more than once.

features.name: Chosen Weapon
features.desc:
A sword saint is proficient in {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and in a single martial or exotic melee weapon of his choice. A sword saint is not proficient with armor or shields and suffers normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} when casting magus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while armored.
At 1st level, a sword saint gains Weapon Focus with his chosen weapon as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

features.name: Canny Defense
features.desc: When wearing light or no armor, wielding his chosen weapon, and not using a shield, a sword saint adds 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) per magus {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} as a dodge bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. If a sword saint is caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} or otherwise denied her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus, she also loses this bonus.

features.name: Perfect Strike
features.desc: At 4th level, when a sword saint hits with his chosen weapon, he can spend 1 point from his arcane pool in order to maximize his weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Don't {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} for damage — the weapon deals maximum damage. This affects only the weapon's base damage dice, not additional damage from sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, magical weapon properties, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellstrike{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. If the sword saint confirms a critical hit, he can instead spend 2 points from his arcane pool to increase his weapon's critical multiplier by 1.

features.name: Fighter Training
features.desc: Starting at 7th level, a sword saint counts his sword saint level –3 as his fighter level for the purpose of qualifying for {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If he has levels in fighter, these levels stack.

features.name: Lightning Draw
features.desc: At 7th level, a sword saint applies his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier as well as his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} (minimum 0).

features.name: Critical Perfection
features.desc:
At 9th level, a sword saint adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (minimum 0) on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} with his chosen weapon.
In addition, the sword saint may use his magus levels in place of his base {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} bonuses to qualify for any {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} for which it is a prerequisite.

features.name: Superior Reflexes
features.desc: At 11th level, a sword saint can make a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This effect stacks with the Combat Reflexes {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

features.name: Lethal Focus
features.desc: At 13th level, when a sword saint is {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacking{/g} a {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} opponent, he adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with his chosen weapon (minimum 0).

features.name: Perfect Reflexes
features.desc: At 19th level, a sword saint's {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is automatically a natural 20.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.desc: At 20th level, any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} a sword saint makes with his chosen weapon automatically confirm all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats and have their {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} multiplier increased by 1 (×2 becomes ×3, for example).

features.name: Ranged Spell Combat
features.desc: Instead of a melee weapon, an eldritch archer must use a ranged weapon for {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} combat. She doesn't need a free hand for ranged spell combat. The eldritch archer cannot accept an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} to cast a spell defensively.

features.name: Ranged Spellstrike
features.desc: At 2nd level, whenever an eldritch archer casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that calls for a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, she can deliver the spell through a ranged weapon she wields as part of a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Instead of the free ranged attack normally allowed to deliver the spell, an eldritch archer can make one free ranged attack with a ranged weapon (at her highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}) as part of casting this spell. The attack does not increase the spell's range.

features.name: Spells
features.desc: A hexcrafter magus adds all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of 6th level or lower that have the curse descriptor to his spellbook.

features.name: Hex Magus
features.desc:
At 4th level, the hexcrafter magus gains access to a small number of witch's hexes. The hexcrafter magus picks one hex from the witch's hex class feature. He gains the benefit of or uses that hex as if he were a witch of a level equal to his magus level.
This feature replaces {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} recall.

features.name: Hex Arcana
features.desc: A hexcrafter may select any witch hex in place of a magus arcana. At 12th level, the hexcrafter may select a hex or major hex in place of a magus arcana. At 18th level, a hexcrafter can select a hex, major hex, or grand hex in place of a magus arcana.

features.name: Major Hexes
features.desc: Starting at 10th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a major hex whenever she could select a new hex.

features.name: Grand Hex
features.desc: Starting at 18th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a grand hex whenever she could select a new hex.

features.name: Arcane Pool
features.desc:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these special abilities consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.

features.name: Medium Armor
features.desc: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 1st level instead of 7th. When wearing medium armor, the armored battlemage gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}. This stacks with the bonus from the Combat Casting {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

features.name: Armor Training
features.desc:
At 3rd level, an armored battlemage gains armor training, as per the fighter ability.
At 8th level, he gains armor training 2.
At 13th level, he gains armor training 3.
At 18th level, he gains armor training 4.

features.name: Arcane Armor +2
features.desc:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these special abilities consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.

features.name: Heavy Armor
features.desc: An armored battlemage gains this ability at 7th level instead of 13th.

features.name: Arcane Armor +3
features.desc:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these special abilities consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.

features.name: Arcane Armor +4
features.desc:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these special abilities consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.

features.name: Arcane Armor +5
features.desc:
An armored battlemage cannot spend points from his arcane pool to enhance weapons. Instead, he can expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant armor he is wearing a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute. For every 4 magus levels he has beyond 1st, the armor gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses stack with existing armor enhancement bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Multiple uses of this ability do not stack.
At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following armor {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: balanced, bitter, fortification (heavy, light, or medium), ghost touch, invulnerability, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} (13, 15, 17, or 19), or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} storing.
Adding these special abilities consumes an amount of bonus equal to the ability's base price modifier. In addition, the armored battlemage can grant his armor the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} special ability at the cost of a +3 bonus or the improved energy resistance special ability at the cost of a +5 bonus. These special abilities are added to any the armor already has, but duplicates do not stack. If the armor is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the arcane pool point is spent and cannot be changed until the next time the armored battlemage uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the armor is worn by anyone other than the magus.

features.name: Spell Dance
features.desc: At 1st level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer gains the ability to expend 1 point from his arcane pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to gain a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his movement rate and a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 minute. For every four levels beyond 1st, the spell dancer gains another +10 enhancement bonus to movement and +2 to AC against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity. At 5th level, once per spell dance as a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, the spell dancer may use blur or haste on himself as a swift action. These abilities last for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 9th level, the spell dancer may instead take a swift action to use dimension door as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} once during a spelldance. At 13th level, the spell dancer may instead choose to take a swift action to gain freedom of movement for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.

features.name: Arcane Movement
features.desc: At 5th level, whenever a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer casts a magus spell, he gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to the spell's level until the beginning of his next turn.

features.name: Dance of Avoidance
features.desc: At 7th level, while wearing light armor or no armor, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer gains a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.

features.name: Greater Dance of Avoidance
features.desc: At 13th level, while wearing light armor or no armor, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dancer's insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} increases to +4.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Arcane Mount
features.desc: Arcane rider's abilities that spend arcane pool also apply to his mount companion.

features.name: Bonus Feats
features.desc: An arcane rider may select Mounted Combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.

features.name: Bonus Magus Feat
features.desc: At 5th level, and every six levels thereafter, a magus gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as combat or magic feats. He must meet the prerequisites for these feats as normal.

features.name: Dimensional Ride
features.desc: An arcane rider gains an opportunity to spend 1 point from his arcane pool and {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to transfer himself and his mount companion from his current location to any other spot within a 30-foot range.

features.name: Greater Dimensional Ride
features.desc: An arcane rider can use dimensional ride as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} now. After teleporting, arcane rider and his mount companion gain the effect of haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to arcane rider's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.

name: Magus
desc: Magi spend much of their time traveling the world, learning whatever martial or arcane secrets they can find. They might spend months learning a new sword-fighting style from a master warrior, while simultaneously moonlighting in the local library, poring through tomes of ancient lore. Most who take this path dabble in all sorts of lore, picking up anything that might aid them in their search for perfection.

archetypes.name: Eldritch Scion
archetypes.desc: Unlike typical magi, eldritch scions do not study tomes of magic or spend time learning to combine martial and magical {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. Rather, eldritch scions find that their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities come to them instinctively.

archetypes.name: Sword Saint
archetypes.desc: A sword saint spends his life focusing his training and meditation into a rapturous perfection of the use of a single weapon, which is usually but not always a sword, channeling his arcane might through it in a dizzying and deadly dance beyond the abilities of even the greatest of mundane warriors.

archetypes.name: Eldritch Archer
archetypes.desc: The eldritch archer rains magical {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} down on her foes.

archetypes.name: Hexcrafter
archetypes.desc: A hexcrafter magus has uncovered the secret of using his arcane pool to recreate witch hexes. These magi can hex friend and foe, curse those they strike, and expand their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} selection to include many curses and harmful spells.

archetypes.name: Armored Battlemage
archetypes.desc: Many battlemages focus purely on destructive evocations, but some extend their tactical studies to include use of the tried-and-true protection of steel. These armored battlemages learn to move and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in even the most restrictive armors, and have developed new methods to magically enhance their armor.

archetypes.name: Spell Dancer
archetypes.desc: The {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strong{/g} emphasis on wizards within elven culture influences how even non-wizard elves see themselves. Many elven magi do not consider themselves masters of a blend of martial and magical talents, but rather a sub-category of wizards who study the effect of physical movement and techniques upon {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} ability. They believe their ability to cast spells while fighting is an outgrowth of the concept of the "spell dance", which itself is just another kind of wizardry.

archetypes.name: Arcane Rider
archetypes.desc: When a magus gains a special bond with his mount, he becomes an Arcane Rider. Magus and his faithful companion not only begin to think as one, but literally become a single arcane entity — they share one arcane pool and can move through dimensions together, plunging enemies into confusion with sudden {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} from nowhere.
